title: London just got more artistic: The Cumberland Hotel launches unique package for art lovers
text: London just got more artistic: The Cumberland Hotel launches unique package for art lovers London just got more artistic: The Cumberland Hotel launches unique package for art lovers THIS summer you can stay at London's most artsy hotel - and peak over the shoulder of famous painters as they work in the lobby. PUBLISHED: 10:07, Thu, Jul 16, 2015 | UPDATED: 10:59, Thu, Jul 16, 2015 ANDREW PORTER Artist Gregory Burns will be painting in the lobby of The Cumberland Hotel this July The Cumberland Hotel hopes to fight off competitors like Tate Modern and National Portrait Gallery by inviting artists to 'paint live' in its lobby. The hotel, located in the heart of London, will welcome contemporary artist and former Paralympian Gregory Burns as its first 'live artist'. American-born Burns, who is an internationally renowned artist, will be creating a collage of his journey throughout London. Burns said: "My painting is inspired by a collection of people with personal experiences and I look forward to adding to it over the next few weeks." As part of the new art initiative, The Cumberland Hotel will offer a special 'Art-full' package to hotel guests, including guided walks through London, visiting the capital's art hot spots, as well as cocktails, a chance to meet Gregory Burns and a tailor made art pack in all hotel rooms.
